enWisdom: Covetousness humiliates
Covetousness is a present humiliation
With covetousness comes humiliation
Coveted objects humiliate men
The coveter is forever abased
The coveter is forever in the shackles of disgrace
Covetousness is one of the two abasements

Wisdom: الْمَذَلَّةُ وَالْمَهَانَةُ وَالشَّقَاءُ فِي الطَّمَعِ وَالْحِرْصِ
enWisdom: Abasement, disgrace and wretchedness are in covetousness and greed
He who covers himself with covetousness has degraded himself
If you give in to covetousness, it will destroy you
Through avidities the necks of men are lowered [in humiliation]
The fruit of covetousness is humiliation in this world and the Hereafter

Wisdom: ذُلُّ الرِّجَالِ فِي الْمَطَامِعِ وَفَنَاءُ الْآجَالِ فِي غُرُورِ الْآمَالِ
enWisdom: The abasement of men is in the things they covet and the passing away of lifetimes is in [following] the deceptions of [false] hopes
Covetousness has been paired with humiliation

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الْحِرْصِ تُشْقِي صَاحِبَهُ وَتُذِلُّ جَانِبَهُ
enWisdom: Too much greed makes its possessor miserable and abases him
One who is possessed by covetousness is humiliated

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُنَزِّهْ نَفْسَهُ عَنْ دَنَاءَةِ الْمَطَامِعِ فَقَدْ أَذَلَّ نَفْسَهُ وَهُوَ فِي الْآخِرَةِ أَذَلُّ وَأَخْزَى
enWisdom: One who does not purify his soul from the lowliness of the coveted has actually abased himself and shall be even more abased and disgraced in the Hereafter
One who covets becomes abased and undergoes hardship

Wisdom: وَرَعٌ يُعِزُّ خَيْرٌ مِنْ طَمَعٍ يُذِلُّ
enWisdom: The piety that dignifies is better than the avarice that humiliates

Wisdom: وَرَعٌ يُنْجِي خَيْرٌ مِنْ طَمَعٍ يُرْدِي
enWisdom: The piety that saves is better than the avarice that ruins

Wisdom: لَا تُمَلِّكْ نَفْسَكَ بِغُرُورِ الطَّمَعِ وَلَا تُجِبْ دَوَاعِيَ الشَّرَهِ فَإِنَّهُمَا يُكْسِبَانِكَ الشَّقَاءَ وَالذُّلَّ
enWisdom: Do not surrender yourself to the deception of covetousness and do not respond to the call of greed, for indeed these two [traits] reap wretchedness and disgrace
There is none more abased than a coveter
There is no quality more abased than covetousness
There is no humiliation greater than covetousness
